devdoc.details: The library provides a mechanism to invalidate objects based on a bit invalidator. The bit invalidator holds a mapping where each key represents a slot number and each value contains an integer. Each bit of the integer represents whether the object with corresponding index is valid or has been invalidated (0 - valid, 1 - invalidated). The nonce given to access or invalidate an entity's state follows this structure: - bits [0..7] represent the object state index in the slot. - bits [8..255] represent the slot number (mapping key).

BitInvalidatedOrder().details: The error is thrown when an attempt is made to invalidate an already invalidated entity.
